your.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: used when speaking or writing to one or more people to show that something belongs to them or is connected with them
your.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: Is that your brother over there?
Don’t worry. It’s not your fault.
Be aware of your own feelings.
your.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: of or belonging to any person
your.translation[0].definitions[1].examp: If you are facing north, east is on your right.
your.translation[0].definitions[2].defin: used when mentioning something that is a typical example of a particular type of thing
your.translation[0].definitions[2].examp: It was just your basic, ordinary hotel room – nothing special.
Your typical 60s pop group had three guitarists and a drummer.
